snippet: Once hundreds of small ivory seizures are accounted for, 2011 could prove to be the worst year for ivory trafficking since officials began keeping global data 23 years ago, a monitoring group says.
abstract: Once hundreds of small ivory seizures are accounted for, 2011 could prove to be the worst year for ivory trafficking since officials began keeping global data 23 years ago, a monitoring group says.
lead_paragraph: If you think you had a bad year, spare a thought for Africa's elephants. They are being killed in ever greater numbers for their ivory, which is smuggled these days mostly to Asia. Rising wealth has led to a boom in demand there in recent years.

headline.main: Boom Year for Illicit Elephant Ivory

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
